summary: This is a government exhibit index from the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, listing evidence to be produced to the defense. It catalogs a wide range of exhibits including message pads, birth certificates of minor victims, physical evidence from properties, photographs, emails, financial records, flight logs, and other documents relevant to the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, referenced throughout the exhibit index in relation to photographs, emails, financial records, and properties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and alleged co-conspirator; referenced in photographs, email chains, flight records, and in relation to properties and victims.

connections.description: Frequently photographed together; referenced in email chains and a relationship essay listed as evidence.

keyFacts: The document is an exhibit index for the prosecution in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a vast amount of evidence was collected.
Evidence includes birth certificates for six minor victims (labeled Victim-1 through Victim-6), indicating the focus on underage individuals.
Physical evidence listed includes massage tables from Florida and New York, a black contact book, hard drives, and a box of costumes.
Photographic evidence includes images of multiple minor victims, Maxwell and Epstein together, and interior/exterior shots of multiple properties linked to them.
Electronic evidence includes email chains between Epstein and minor victims, and between Epstein and Maxwell, as well as lists of women and masseuses.
